140548177.review:
Life is Strange is an episodic graphic adventure game developed by Dontnod Entertainment and published by Square Enix. The complete season includes all five episodes of the game, which were released between January and October of 2015.

One of the standout features of Life is Strange is its gripping storyline and character development. The game follows the story of Maxine Caulfield, a high school student who discovers she has the power to rewind time. As Max navigates through her life in the town of Arcadia Bay, she makes decisions that affect the outcome of the game's narrative.

The game's writing and voice acting are superb, creating a believable and immersive world for the player to inhabit. The characters in the game are well-developed and relatable, with their own unique personalities and struggles. The game tackles issues such as friendship, bullying, mental illness, and time travel, creating a deep and thought-provoking narrative.

The game's graphics and art style are also stunning, with a hand-painted aesthetic that adds to the game's emotional impact. The game's soundtrack is also excellent, with a range of indie and alternative songs that perfectly capture the game's mood and tone.

One of the game's most significant strengths is the ability for the player to make choices that affect the outcome of the game's narrative. These choices have far-reaching consequences and make the player feel invested in the game's characters and story.

However, some players may find the game's slow pacing and lack of traditional gameplay mechanics to be frustrating. The game is more focused on storytelling and character development, rather than action and adventure.

Overall, Life is Strange is an exceptional graphic adventure game that offers a gripping storyline, well-developed characters, and a unique time-travel mechanic. The game's emotional impact, stunning graphics, and excellent soundtrack make it a must-play for fans of the genre. However, players looking for traditional gameplay mechanics and action-packed gameplay may be disappointed.

140493425.review:
[h1]My Experience with this Amazing Game[/h1]

I played this game back in 2018 or 2019 on my mobile phone, and when I reached Episode 5, one of my classmates deleted the game, and I couldn't complete it at that time. Unfortunately, I didn't have a PC back then, so I struggled a lot. However, recently I saw that this game was on sale for a very affordable price of $1.38 USD. So, on June 14, 2023, I bought it, and today, on June 22, 2023, I completed the entire game and unlocked all the Steam achievements.

Life is Strange games are really good, and their stories are super amazing. This game is worth every penny. For $1.38 USD, I got all the episodes of this game, and each and every episode felt like I was watching a thrilling suspense movie.  The game's graphics and visuals still look really good even after all these years. Kudos to the whole team who made this amazing game.

The game's graphics look pretty good, the gameplay and controls are very easy, and the story is just amazing. I can guarantee that everyone will love the story 👌🏻 . Unlocking the Steam achievements in this game is really easy, and they are not hard at all. Everyone can unlock all 60 achievements very easily. Some choices were very hypothetical, making it difficult to choose one option. Especially the last hypothetical choices of the game. Those last choices were very hard to make, but the ending was good. I will say that the last hypothetical choices were the most difficult choices in gaming history 🤯

While playing Episode 5, I felt like I was experiencing everything in real life. The story literally blew my mind, and I kept thinking about this game and its characters all day. This game was also relatable to me as I had a friend, but since 2019, I haven't been in touch with him, so it felt like the character Max was based on my life. LOL. Also, this game taught me many things that will help me in my life, such as the "Power of Choice", "Empathy and Understanding", "Dealing with Consequences" and most importantly, "Friendship and Loyalty" and "Appreciating the Present."

Lastly, I want to take a moment to appreciate all the devs who worked on this game and made it amazing 👏🏻 . Also, we can't ignore the hard work of all the voice actors. Each and every actor did their best job, and I really appreciate them. They are the best😃🔥

Thank you for reading until here.❤️

140399186.review:
I didn't have a chance to play this game when it first came out, but I finally(!) picked it up during a Steam sale the other day, and loved it.  Despite the age of the game, and some technical limitations that come along with that, the visuals and story still hold out strong as a work of art.

First and foremost, this is more of a story than a game in the traditional sense.  Each scene of the game is like a scene in a novel, in which you can explore around, interactive with people and look at random items from peoples' lives.  The scene advances when some plot objective is reached, but there's no urgency in advancing through the narrative.  Most interactions are irrelevant to the plot, they're just there to experience, kind of like browsing though art in a gallery.  I found it relaxing just interacting with the mundane posters and other objects in the scenery, which each tell a small part of life in Arcadia Bay.

There are some puzzles where you have to use your powers to advance the narrative, but mostly it's about the story itself, and the choices you make along the way.  The fact that you can't easily quick save / reload adds weight to your choices, and forces you to take ownership of them.

Playing the game now, long after all the episodes have been released and people have moved on to other things, adds a kind of new meta-layer to the experience. Like the Polaroid photos that are ubiquitous in the story, the game itself is now like a vintage snapshot of a moment in the past.  The feeling of isolation in Max Caulfield's experience is even more acute now, as is the question of how relevant are the choices made in terms of the bigger picture.

140395368.review:
For those looking for a shortened version, here it is: 10/10 Game very good, made me cry very much. Love the music. 

For those looking for my thoughts and feelings on the game, read on:

Life is Strange is probably one of the greatest game I have ever played in my several years on Steam. Yes I am very late to playing it and fully enjoying it's story but I think that this game has held strong over those years. It's story still beats any game I have played recently or any game that will probably come out in the years to come. But then again, this is coming from someone who is biased so take this review with a pinch of salt. 

Yes the graphics may not be the best but this game does not rely on that to impress it's players, it's the amazing attention to detail and the world building that does. This game focuses so heavily on being able to tell a story through the world and art style rather than hitting us with a two paragraph bit of text telling us what happened or is happening. 

This game will subvert your expectations from the very start until the very end, the whole scope of the game changing how the player will think and feel until it finally clicks in the players head and they finally understand. This game is filled with mystery, happiness and loss, there will be times where you think "God I wish I hadn't of said that" or "Jesus, I didn't see any of this coming" that's because this game gives you the ability to change your fate and others. 

Another great part of this game is it's soundtrack, many moments will be accompanied by music that fits the tone extremely well, almost like it was made for it. As you get further into the game, this music will become more hard hitting and at some points bring out some emotions to help bring those scenes to completion. 

To end things off as I do not wish to make this review too long winded, I fully recommend this game to those who have yet to purchase this master piece, just like 96% of the community who has. I also recommend a box of tissues and to play this game with good sound. I cannot recommend the remake of this game yet though as I haven't played it, though all I have seen from it is that it just makes the overall look of the game better. So if you're reading this, have a look at both and make a just decision. 

Thank you for reading, hope you all have a good time either playing or replaying this magnificent game.

I am going to keep this review short and spoiler free, so everyone can read without wasting much time.

Would I recommend this game? Yes. I am an competitive FPS player and this game is more like a visual novel/movie than a game, so it can be really frustrating to play if you are not used to a slow paced story mode game. That being said, the art style of this game is definitely different. Unlike Detroit: Become Human, this game does not have realistic graphics, but an individual-looking hand-drawn art style. This sets the game apart when it comes to graphics. In terms of gameplay, the game is well optimized, and does not stutter or lag a single bit, I did not suffer from even 1 frame drop throughout the 20 hour gameplay. This game is best enjoyed on a big monitor/tv with a controller in your hand.

The game contains 5 episodes, each episode ranging around 3 hours in length. You can either play this game in one sitting like I did, or the more advisable way in which you can enjoy it would be to play it on 5 separate days, 1 episode per day. This is definitely up to you, but the game did get annoying for me and I had to power through it. The way things elevate in this game, the twists and suspense, the choices and the "what if" moments are just beautiful to say the least. If I had to sum this game up in one sentence, I'd say this is the final destination movie series turned into a game, with obviously some differences. The music is very soothing, and the ending is definitely different.

TL:DR: Definitely a worth try. Episode One is free on steam and the game requirements are not high at all. Have a crack at it, episode one is only 3 hours. Remember to get a controller as well, I did not have one.

140272031.review:
If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

140204652.review: Although some of you may give this a pass upon first look. Let me tell you, that would a mistake. Especially if you're a fan of games released by Telltale, & Quantic Dream. Featuring Max Caulfield as the protagonist, a young woman who discovers she has incredible powers. You join her wholesome and pretentious journey as she learns to improve her talents. Her character does share some resemblance to my own personality. Since this game is old, there should be no problems running it. So performance is great. While non-linear, this games story brings out nostalgia with the games artstyle, dialogue, setting, and soundtrack. Extream depth to the characters, especially Chloe Price, the deuteragonist of the story. Overall the story is timeless and honestly transcendent. I won't ever forget it as long as I live. Since this is a game featuring interactive storytelling, your actions will have consequences. If you're interested, you should check out the prequel "Life is Strange: Before the Storm" before playing this game. While its not required or also recommended by some fans. It'll improve your experience and give you more background to the setting and characters.

I finished the game today and I want to say that this game is a work of art.. It has amazing good music, sweet graphics, a beautiful scenario and great characters. But the thing that made me love the game the most was that it taught a lesson. 

[spoiler] I have a lot of sympathy for this game because it taught me a lesson: you can't escape the truth.. I hated David early in the game and was so happy when Chloe's biological father William came along, but then things took a turn for the worse. In Episode 5, Chloe died. His crying when we tell her clearly tells us how much he loves his stepdaughter and how much he truly cares for his family. And that's when I realized I had made a mistake and accepted David, he's a good father just because he's an ex-military so he doesn't show much love for his family. I sacrificed Chloe at the end of the game because that's what it was meant to be. Both characters started to mature as the episodes progressed, of course, especially Max, in Episode 5, she already has a fight with herself. In short, this game taught me that we can't escape reality and that sometimes we just accept situations. it was a great game for me [/spoiler]

140173662.review:
Life is strange is really good but not perfect
For starters, I'm not so sure your "choices matter" all that much.
For starters, there are only two possible endings and the ending you get is based on the last question you answer, not on any previous questions you have answered. 
Second, in the beginning of each episode you get a "previously on" which sums up the entire story until your current place. Except it leaves out all the choices you made, leading me to think that this "plot skeleton" is the same for everyone, regardless of your choices. 
Your choices do matter, however, they just don't effect where the overall story is going. People will remember your choices and there will be short term consequences to your actions.

The story is pretty good. I finished it in about 3 days (this is pretty good for me, It normally takes a few months of playing a 14hr story game (from howlongtobeat.com)
The characters were also interesting, although I thought Chloe was slightly annoying (I didn't hate her, but sometimes she would say something cringey) I found other people a little annoying too, I was worried about it because I had previously played the beginning of "true colors" and found everyone extremely pretentious and annoying. There is a little bit of that with Warren (I think that was his name) who is a film nerd.

140017875.review:
With some cringey yet lovable awkward dialogue and intriguing mystery locked behind hours of pointing and clicking, Life Is Strange could almost be overlooked entirely. However, it makes up for its corny wordplay with a story full of twists and turns and red herrings that one could easily fall for. If you are a lover of story-driven games and generally enjoy games as a storytelling medium- this game is wrapped in a ribbon for you.

Life Is Strange is one of those gems that receives flack for being controversial in its approach to difficult subjects simply by showcasing them. As everyone has a different opinion regarding such themes I won't touch upon them in this review- however, I believe they handled heavy subjects with grace and respect. Sometimes, things that are hard to hear-  those truths of life that we wish we could turn away from- are still the truth nonetheless.

The gameplay is actually quite decent for a story-driven game, and provides just enough player interaction to keep you on your toes, or awake at the very least. The devs definitely were creative in the ways they chose the player to interact with the Life Is Strange world and I appreciated it most during some of the detective-work sequences in which the player has to figure out mystery puzzles. 

Is it a movie-game? Somewhat so, but you will feel immersed in the story regardless. The cinematography alone is worth picking up Life Is Strange. If you're a lover of the arts, theatre, film in general- you will appreciate many of the incredible and nuanced scenes within. You can tell the dev team is as passionate about the arts as the characters.

For my one worthwhile nitpick, I will say this- the claim that choices gravely affect the narrative is not completely truthful. Your choices affect the dialogue and small details of the story, but generally do not interfere with the main narrative. You will still have the same choices in the end. I somewhat wish there were more contrasting routes, but it might be best this way- completionists would have a nightmare with the length of possible routes if so. I know I would have.

Who is this game for? Lovers of mystery, detective work, a convincing story and the romantics. Give it a chance. I doubt you will regret it if you stick around until the ending. (And go play the prequel after!)

i have to appreciate this game as the very first entry in the life is strange series because the setup for the series' formula was just. chef's kiss. like, i agree with a ton of this game's criticisms, i really do, but i wouldn't change a thing about it to be honest. not the gameplay, not the characters, not the presentation of the story, not even the clusterfuck that was episode 5 specifically. because a game about rewinding time and creating alternate realities climaxing at the most david lynch shit ever is to be expected in my opinion. all of this does not unfortunately save the game from being a victim of french writers trying to find out how american teens spoke in 2013, though i do find the dialogue very charming because of that. chloe price you will always be famous for saying "hella" 13 times total. max will not be famous for "wowser" though

on a more serious note, i think this game's story is masterful. i think the sort of "red herring" of it being about trying to find rachel amber then being revealed to just simply being that chloe can't die is so interesting to me. i also adore how mark jefferson is the root of every single bad thing happening in this game. i.e. rachel disappearing, literally everything with kate, and manipulating nathan into doing his dirty work, and hell, even chloe getting shot in the bathroom. literally none of this would've happened if that prude wasn't a freak

9/10 would cause a storm via the butterfly effect again

139759981.review:
Life is Strange is an amazing journey, held back by a underwhelming ending.

I do believe it's a story worth experiencing but I will list some of the gripes I had so you can temper your expectations.

There are times when the rewind power is really well utilized in the gameplay sequences, but the mechanics of which bring into question why these mechanics don't apply in some of the cutscenes. (This is something minor that I can overlook for as good a story this is!)

Some of the episodes have really heartfelt bonding between characters and their characters evolve in ways that are satisfying, but you won't get much closure to these bonds.

There are two major plot threads throughout the game, the subplot becomes the focus for most of the game and, as much as I love this subplot, the main plot gets kinda pushed to the side. Many plot holes and story decisions (due to the ending) leave you asking "why?"

139755914.review: Life is Strange? More like Life is Seriously Strange, dude! 🤯 This game took me on a wild emotional rollercoaster, and I'm still trying to recover from the feels. It's like a mixtape of teen angst, time-travelling shenanigans, and decisions that make you question your own existence. I mean, who knew saving the world could be so complicated? And let's not forget about the mind-bending plot twists that hit you like a meteor shower! But in all seriousness, it's got a beautifully emotional soundtrack consisting of some really fantastic indie music, stunning visuals, and characters you'll want to hug and protect. Pricefield forever, man! This game is seriously awesome! 10/10, would rewind time to play again!

139617020.review:
Life is Strange is not only a game, but it is an experience. With its stunning choice of music, immersive game mechanics, and an incredible storyline, this game sets a new standard for interactive storytelling.

The music in Life is Strange is nothing short of exceptional. Each track perfectly complements the mood of every scene, enhancing the emotional impact of the narrative. From soothing melodies to energetic tunes, the soundtrack adds depth to the game's atmosphere, making it an unforgettable experience despite the old graphics. (which you wont even realise due to these factors)

The game mechanics are seamlessly integrated, allowing players to rewind time and shape the story's outcome. This unique feature provides a fresh perspective on decision-making, keeping you engaged and emotionally invested in every choice you make. The power to alter destiny is in your hands, and it's an exhilarating journey.

Speaking of the story, Life is Strange offers a gripping narrative that tackles profound themes such as friendship, love, loss, and identity. The plot unfolds beautifully, taking unexpected turns that will leave you breathless. It's a rollercoaster of emotions, and you'll find yourself questioning your own choices and their consequences.

The dialogues and voice acting are top-notch, bringing the characters to life with authenticity and depth. The conversations are natural, witty, and at times heart-wrenching. The voice actors' performances are so convincing that you'll feel an instant connection with the characters, forging a bond that lingers even after you've finished the game.

Life is Strange is an extraordinary masterpiece that deserves all the praise it receives. Its choice of music, immersive game mechanics, gripping storyline, and outstanding dialogues and voice acting make it an unforgettable experience. Prepare yourself for an emotional rollercoaster that will leave a lasting impact on your soul.

Masterpiece / 10
the best out off all the life is strange franchise

139074342.review: I can't bring myself to like Life is Strange. Sure, this game has some things I liked about it - a handful of likable characters, a rather emotional story, and the time rewind mechanic - but the faults are much more numerous than its strengths.  There are some plot holes and plot contrivances, dialogue that metronomes between alright and cringe even for the time, characters not growing in this character driven story, and the ending [spoiler] not being a culmination of all your choices before, but a binary choice [/spoiler]. You should really only play this game if you're desperate for teen drama point and click adventure, but Life is Strange is still just average at best.

138627306.review:
TL;DR :

Nah, not for me. If you like slow paced, character focused games and have a bit of time on your hands (15/20h) then maybe for you.



A bit more time and no spoilers :

It wasn't that bad, just a big letdown from what I expected. I can't give the game a thumbs up for that reason. And seeing how well it sold and how overwhelmingly positive the reviews are I do not believe it matters anyway.
I would recommend the game for sales and if you got 15/20h to throw away, are easily moved, don't care too much about inconsistencies, are not at all looking for any kind of neat SF or well done coherent time travel, are not bothered by slow paced videogames (especially episode 1/2) and very little gameplay (goes from taking photos of very specific things to looking for bottles in a dump so yeah).

So if you just want a chill, relaxing game with nice visuals then maybe. I did not like most of the characters but their development isn't so bad (even tho they're all super cliché) and they are subtle enough that I guess some people will grow to appreciate them a lot or even from the get go  (and seeing the popularity and overwhemingly positive reviews and how character focused the game is I guess it's the case).

Honestly, it felt very teensy and I don't see any of my more than 16 acquaintances/friends really appreciate the game (especially to the extent it is loved), except if the ones that are very new to video games and haven't read/watched that many stuff/aren't very critical about what they "consume".



SPOILERS. SPOILERS EVERYWHERE :

It was fine. But honestly I'm so disappointed. I expected some good storytelling, lovable characters, a well done time travel focused story, but... The game is full of contradictions and inconsistencies at every levels. Whether it be on how the powers of Max worked (like the fact that she can teleport, wth?) or in terms of plot. I'm too lazy to develop how bad those inconsistencies are with the plot, there are far too many and multiples in every episode. For instance, how Chloe just sits there with Max on her lap after seeing her nosebleed then pass out. Any sensible human being would call an ambulance in such a situation, would he not? It's a small thing (and not the best example) but when you add several per episode it starts getting on your nerves and did for me. It made the characters less belivable and broke the immersion.

Speaking of characters, I found most if not ALL of them to be quite insufferable, unbelievably insecure (and I know it is one of the main topics but still it was too much for me) and hella self-centered (including Max always comparing herself to Rachel like an 8 yo). And they felt way too edgy and weirdly "young" (in a "I'm a 45yo man trying to write teenage girls/boys") to feel real and be attached to them. 

I also found most of the choices and their impact to be very artificially and clumsily implemented in the game (like how some characters will just spit out that you were nice to them and thus they will help you or whathever, very elder scrollsy now that I think about it). 

Lastly, the pacing was also pretty bad and I felt bored most of the time, the inexistant (in terms of complexity and fun) and yet very present gameplay didn't help (looking for bottles, taking pictures of specific stuff in your notebook instead of just offering the player the possibility to make his own photos).

By the end, I sadly still did not care for most of the characters and what could happen to them. 

And I did not enjoy the ending of the game tbh, it felt empty and meaningless (and the whole chaos theory thing is insufferable, makes no sense, like the double moon and unpredicted eclipse (let's not speak of the storm and the fact that it seems god/destiny/Poseidon brings it if Chloe does not die because that's how the world works). It's nice in the visuals prism of things but it's dumb and brings an unwelcomed aura of superstition to the story that was veeeery strange (like how the Science teacher/Warren were like "an unpredicted eclipse (which is a very predictable event)? Oh well, guess weird things happen sometimes". In the real world, which LiS is supposed to be set in, such a event would lead the scientific community to a very different reaction). 

I'm also not sure I'm a fan of the whole episodic nature of LiS and how this game aired originally. And I have that complain for pretty much all games that do it. But almost none do that anymore to my knowledge, so I'll it go...

I could go on and on and probably forgot half of what I had to say about the game but you get the idea.

For what I did like now : the voice actors are ok, the music too (not great imo but fits the tone of the game) and there are some actual really neat visuals in the game, especially in the last episode. And overall, the artistic direction is nice. I was quite bored throughout the game but not so much that I didn't want to finish it so I'll put it as a good point, but maybe I was just in the mood.

Overall, it really was meh. I would sorta recommend it to certain people (especially younger ones) but then I would also recommend Telltales games like WD or The Wolf Among Us and many other before if the person wants a narrative focused game (heard that Night in the Woods is amazing and deals with similar topics as LiS, but I have not played it).

I worry people with a certain experience with narrative games / people that are more critical and maybe older in general might be quite disappointed by what this game is. I sure was. Now again, seeing how overwhelmingly positive the reviews were and are still, there might be something I cannot see.

138492551.review:
This should be called Gaslighting: the game.

It tricks you into believing your choices matter: they don't. It wants you to think the two main characters have a meaningful relationship: they don't. And it tries to pretend the writers know how teenagers think and act: they clearly don't.

This is not actually a game, it's a long, drawn-out Trolley Experiment with outdated graphics. I'm sure it wasn't that bad in 2015, but the helmet hair, dead eyes and rubber skin are painful to look at in 2023.

The main mechanic of rewinding time is so interesting, I really wanted to like this game. But the writing is just so stilted and cringey. Such a missed opportunity.

138099286.review:
Life is Strange es un juego de aventuras y drama interactivo que se centra en la historia de la estudiante de último año de preparatoria llamada Maxine "Max" Caulfield, quien descubre que tiene la habilidad de retroceder en el tiempo y cambiar el curso de la historia. El primer episodio del juego establece el tono para la trama emocionalmente cargada y los temas maduros que el juego explora.

La jugabilidad del primer episodio de Life is Strange se enfoca en la exploración y la conversación. Los jugadores controlan a Max mientras se mueve por el entorno y tiene conversaciones con otros personajes. La habilidad de retroceder el tiempo de Max también se utiliza para resolver rompecabezas y avanzar en la trama. En términos de jugabilidad, el primer episodio de Life is Strange recibe una calificación de 8 sobre 10.

En cuanto al apartado gráfico, el juego presenta un estilo artístico único que combina un estilo de dibujo animado con detalles realistas en el entorno. A pesar de que el juego fue lanzado en 2015, los gráficos siguen siendo impresionantes y atractivos. Además, la música y los efectos de sonido del juego complementan perfectamente la atmósfera del juego. En términos de apartado gráfico, el primer episodio de Life is Strange recibe una calificación de 9 sobre 10.

En términos de rejugabilidad, el primer episodio de Life is Strange ofrece múltiples decisiones que afectan el curso de la trama y cómo los personajes interactúan con Max. Estas decisiones también afectan el desarrollo de los personajes y los eventos en episodios posteriores. Los jugadores pueden volver a jugar el episodio para descubrir las diferentes ramificaciones de sus decisiones. En términos de rejugabilidad, el primer episodio de Life is Strange recibe una calificación de 7 sobre 10.

En cuanto a horas de juego, el primer episodio de Life is Strange puede ser completado en unas pocas horas. Sin embargo, la trama y los personajes son lo suficientemente interesantes para que los jugadores quieran seguir jugando los episodios restantes. En términos de horas de juego, el primer episodio de Life is Strange recibe una calificación de 6 sobre 10.

En general, el primer episodio de Life is Strange es un comienzo sólido para el juego. Con una trama emocionante y temas maduros, el juego es un gran ejemplo de cómo los juegos pueden ser una forma efectiva de contar historias. Con una calificación promedio de 7.5 sobre 10, el primer episodio de Life is Strange es un juego que vale la pena jugar para cualquier fan de los juegos de aventuras y drama interactivo.

138035559.review:
Life is Strange is a critically acclaimed episodic adventure game developed by Dontnod Entertainment and published by Square Enix. The game revolves around the life of a teenage girl named Maxine Caulfield, who discovers she has the ability to rewind time. With this power, she embarks on a journey to uncover the secrets of her small town and prevent a devastating storm from destroying everything she holds dear.

The game's strength lies in its unique storytelling, which is full of emotional depth and character development. The choices players make throughout the game have real consequences, and the game's multiple endings depend on the player's decisions. The game also tackles mature themes, such as bullying, suicide, and mental health, in a thoughtful and sensitive way.

The graphics are beautiful, and the game's music perfectly captures the mood and atmosphere of the story. The voice acting is superb, with every character feeling like a real person with their own unique personality and motivations.

Overall, Life is Strange is an excellent game that stands out in the adventure genre. Its engaging story, relatable characters, and meaningful choices make it a must-play for fans of narrative-driven games.

137452350.review:
Life is Strange is a game that truly touched my heart and left me feeling emotional and moved by the end. From the moment I started playing, I was drawn in by the stunning visuals, captivating storyline, and relatable characters that made me feel like I was a part of their world.

At its core, Life is Strange is a game about friendship, love, loss, and the difficult choices that we all face in life. As I played through the game and made decisions that impacted the outcome of the story, I found myself becoming deeply invested in the lives of the characters, and their struggles felt like my own.

The game's unique time-travel mechanic added an extra layer of complexity to the story, allowing me to explore different paths and see the consequences of my actions. But what really made this game special was the way it tackled difficult themes like depression, suicide, and family dysfunction with sensitivity and empathy, never shying away from the harsh realities of life.

As the game reached its climax, I found myself moved to tears by the emotional payoff that all my choices and interactions had led up to. It was a bittersweet moment that left me feeling both heartbroken and fulfilled, a testament to the power of storytelling and the human experience.

In conclusion, Life is Strange is a masterpiece of storytelling that will leave you feeling emotional and invested in the lives of its characters. It's a game that tackles difficult themes with sensitivity and empathy, and reminds us that even in the darkest moments of our lives, there is always hope and the possibility of redemption. If you're looking for a game that will leave you moved and inspired, look no further than Life is Strange.

137399522.review: I love the *&@# out of this game. I will be playing it at least a few more times just to see where it takes me. 136846780.review:
Like so many other games I have bought on Steam, I bought Life is Strange during a Steam sale, back in 2016. The game sat firmly in the library until one day in 2021 where I installed it for the first time.

Life is strange was not an easy game to start, it was as a matter of fact one of the most boring games I've ever played. First of all I always like to get into the games I play, and for this game it required A LOT of reading about a bunch of people and things I didn't know anything about. Basically you had a journal, that would keep filling through the game, a character sheet, with information regarding important people in the game, and a bunch of stupid SMS'es. To top it of I had to also deal with a young white girl, trying to speak and do gang signs like a black person, and being cool, when not really feeling it, even when trying hard. The game focuses a lot on relationships and how people see eachother, but as the main character and protagonist Max or Maxine, you decide if you're gonna make things better or worse.

For the 2nd part of starting this game, it was a lot more different than other games I have played. Even interacting with objects and people felt weird, but most importantly...having to do stuff over and over again. I can understand that making mistakes may want you to replay stuff. That's how most games with a save is, but the choices you have to take, requires a lot of extra time spent thinking, and doing stuff over, mostly the conversations.

So to sum up the first part of this review. The game was not very easy to start for me, and I even deleted my save and started the game over again, because so much time had passed. Still, I would almost always choose a different game to play than Life is Strange...simply because it didn't really feel like a game for me. After actually getting into the game for reals, I started to think really hard about this already early. 

See. Life is Strange has a lot of choices, and choices that can lead to drama...this game had A LOT of drama. It's almost like you can never make everyone happy. You always have to make a choice that disappoints someone else. On top of this, Life is Strange is actually a pretty emotional game, and I sat there more than once yelling out into the room "WTF am I supposed to do now?" Yes, it can make you feel stuff, but as a grown, adult man, do I really care that much about it?

This game will be different for everyone, but how much we care about it is something else. Would a younger person, a girl playing this game, feel different about this, than me? Cringe less when certain words or phrases are being said. I know for sure that I had some cringy moments, some emotional moments, but it was more because you're getting more and more into the story.

In the end I think the game and story was well made, but this game was not for me. I bought it, installed it and played it all through, but I never felt it was a game for me. The start was boring, the endless choices made me annoyed, but most of all, I didn't really know what to say about this. There was a lot of drama; heck the game was even exciting and you kinda wanted to keep playing. However, when I was getting close to the end of the game and the story, I kinda wanted it to be over, so I could play something I appreciate more.

So to end this review. This game was not for me, and I should have given it a thumbs down, and not recommend it, but I think that there are people that would appreciate this game more than me, and so I would definitely say that you should give it a chance...simply because it's very much different to other games.

136803196.review:
Life is Strange is an episodic adventure game that tells the story of Max Caulfield, a photography student who discovers she can rewind time and change the course of events. Along with her childhood friend Chloe, she investigates the mysterious disappearance of a fellow student and uncovers dark secrets about her town and herself.

The game is divided into five episodes, each lasting about two to three hours. The gameplay consists mainly of exploring the environments, interacting with characters, and making choices that affect the outcome of the story. The game also features a few puzzles that require using Max’s time powers to manipulate objects or situations.

The game’s strongest point is its story, which is engaging, emotional, and unpredictable. The game tackles serious issues such as bullying, suicide, drugs, and violence with sensitivity and maturity. The characters are well-written and believable, and their relationships are complex and dynamic. The game also has a great soundtrack that fits the mood and tone of each scene.

The game’s weakest point is its technical aspect, which is not very polished or consistent. The game suffers from graphical glitches, animation errors, lip-sync issues, and occasional bugs. The voice acting is also uneven, ranging from excellent to mediocre. The game’s pace can also be slow at times, especially in the first episode.

Overall, Life is Strange is a memorable and impactful game that deserves praise for its narrative and artistic vision. It is not perfect, but it is ambitious and original. I would recommend it to anyone who enjoys story-driven games with meaningful choices and consequences. I give it 8.5 out of 10.

136487231.review:
Hold up, it's been years since my first play of Life is Strange and I just realised I never left a comment, knowing myself I assume it's because I couldn't believe what I went through in the game... I don't even know where to start, a lot of us said we want amnesia and forget this game so we can repeat the feeling over and over again-- it's the unfortunate fact. This game was an experience, it's painful and beautiful which is life is mostly is in between. I'm in my 30s but this game hit me so hard because some of the experiences I had in my youth are so relatable to the game, and that is something I cherish a lot. 

I can say for sure though, even though we have the freedom of choice on how the game ends, I have always perceived people who chose to save Chloe are the ones who has gone through the deepest thought of love before, and that is something I stand by for. The arguements will always be there, because not all understands what it's like. ANW-- to close the debate somehow, in the official comics it's canon that Chloe is alive and Max went further with her powers that she even travels dimension- where another universe Rachel is alive (F--K Rachel BTW) and with Chloe. Victoria happens to be alive which I'm glad as well. 

Thank you devs, if any of you are reading this, LiS is something that I come back to annually to remember the experience and the bond Max and Chloe has. I hope something similar can come by again, because I didn't feel it on LiS3. Tell Me Why and LiS2 were next on my list of the good ones.

136473061.review:
It's a pretty fun game with interesting decisions, but there is some issues.

I'll start with the Pros.
Pros
-----
-Can be a entertaining fun game
-Has great graphics
-Can be re-playable for Achievements and different Decision making
-Time Travel is a good idea for a game
-Can be a fun and easy adventure game and that you can get into the characters
-Interesting Plot-lines

Now for the cons:
Look, I loved this game and looked at all of the theories and game plays, but I can't say it isn't flawless and is defiantly not a masterpiece.

First of all, the decision making doesn't actually change anything really, just a little plot that fades away so whatever you choose doesn't really matter, and that you get to choose which ending you get which makes all of your decisions pointless and meaningless.

Second, Max, the character, always agrees with Chloe and we never get a say, to tell Chloe she's wrong or what she needs to do, also, Chloe is supposed to be the character we have sympathy for, but I am feeling none for her and all of her mistakes is her fault and she blames someone else for no reason!

Third, You can't really explore in this game, like you just stay in one place, which makes things not very adventurous and makes the game a bit boring as you can't progress in the small plot lines, like with Taylor's Mother being sick in the hospital (I think that's what was happening?) Or Victoria's character development, Or Samuel's backstory with Rachel, we didn't get anymore of that, it was just mentioned and never seen again.

Fourth, How did Max get her superpowers? It never really was explained, I also didn't get how all of sudden she can go into pictures and change the past? Plus, that alternate reality thing didn't really matter and didn't do anything, the only thing we figured out is that Nathan was the one that crashed into Chloe, that was basically it.

Fifth & Final, the endings felt so basic, the first one with Chloe dying was actually pretty good and made me sad but the second ending with destroying the whole town was stupid and pointless, I also don't get why they chose the second ending to be the canon ending, I prefer the first one as it made more sense and actually made you feel sympathy for the character, but they had to rekt that whole thing up! Mr. Jefferson was also a stupid character, having him telling us what his plan was, didn't make any sense as we were blacked out, did he just wanted someone to talk to.. or..? I also wished they kept the whole plot-line of Nathan knowing about the storm, it would've made things more interesting, and maybe your decision making would either save Nathan or Nathan will die by Jefferson? Something to get the people playing entertained to be excited for what's going to happen next!

Now don't get me wrong, I did enjoy playing Life is Strange, but if it had more thought and passion into it, I think it would've done all lot better, though this is just my opinion.
I recommend this game because it can be fun replaying at times and making decisions kept me entertained, though there were flaws in this game.
Though, I'd probably play again to look at more stuff and get more achievements.
I would defiantly try out the other Life is Strange games though.
anyways, thanks for listening!

136458857.review: I absolutely fell in love with this game when I first played it all those years ago. Definitely need to go back to replay this one. You will fall in love with the world and the characters and the lessons they will teach you about making life-changing choices and how they will affect you. Even with the ability to rewind time, you are still faced with these difficult choices that you can't take back once they're made. It is a heavily story-based game so there isn't too much difficult gameplay but it is a story that can pull you in. It's definitely not for everyone and the character Chloe herself might be very mixed but I personally didn't mind her and could really relate to her on many things. But if you like a very story based mystery narrative that involves choices affecting your story and what will happen, I will definitely say give this one a go.

Overall, I really love this game and It always makes me kind of nostalgia whenever I play it, 100% recommend

136397733.review:
Life is Strange es uno de esos juegos que se quedan contigo mucho después de haberlo terminado. La historia es profundamente conmovedora y trata temas difíciles como la depresión, el acoso escolar y el abuso de drogas de una manera realista y sensible.

Los personajes están muy bien desarrollados y es fácil empatizar con ellos. La mecánica del juego de viajar en el tiempo para tomar decisiones y cambiar el curso de la historia es muy interesante y agrega una capa adicional de complejidad a la trama.

La banda sonora es excepcional y se adapta perfectamente al ambiente del juego. Además, los gráficos y la animación son impresionantes, lo que hace que la experiencia sea aún más inmersiva.

Si te gustan los juegos con una buena historia y personajes convincentes, Life is Strange es definitivamente para ti. Es un juego emocionante y satisfactorio que te mantendrá enganchado hasta el final. Sin duda alguna, es una de las mejores aventuras gráficas que he jugado en los últimos años y recomiendo encarecidamente que lo pruebes.

136241881.review: I have yet to play another game that is as emotional and immersive game as Life is Strange. The mechanics are straight forward, and the graphics aren't amazing, but the narrative that explores so many different themes can allow anyone to relate and let them be nostalgic, even for times they never experienced. Anyone that has ever experienced the feeling of wishing they could go back will love this game, and the soundtrack puts it over the top. The game explores themes like friendship, grief, and how sometimes no matter how hard you try, sometimes things are just meant to be how they're meant to be. The episodes just get better and better as they go, leaving you with a story that will always stick with you. My favorite story game to date, and after playing, I am sure anyone can see why.

136032569.review: This game is so beautifully made, from the music to the visuals and the character development. I found myself becoming so attached to each character and dreading the day the the game would end. The choices in this game were so well planned and thought out and the developers did an amazing job at making the game one that hits you right in the heart. I loved getting to see the difference in numbers when it came to what other players picked for big choices. The story line of this game is an emotional roller coaster and one that I would definitely go on again to make different choices and see how it plays out. Arcadia Bay is such a beautiful place and I loved getting to explore parts of it. I loved the music that would play in the background during some scenes and while it played during Max's inner dialogue cuts when you would sit her down somewhere. This game brought tears to my eyes from how hard one of the choices were and that's not really a feeling I've ever gotten before from a decision based game. I would recommend this game to anyone and I'm a lot of the other positive reviewers here would agree.

135923567.review:
I remember the first time that I played this game. It was during the summer and I was playing with my cousin, we were just kids, I was 12 and she was 15. I remember of us laughing and also crying in the various moments that this game have offered to us. I never knew that Chloe's life would later become so relatable to me at the point that I can safely say that I've passed through everything that she passed during the game and also at Before The Storm. This game has shaped who I am and I'm so glad it did.

In the same year that I've played the game my mother passed away, almost like the game was a warning for what I would be going to pass through. I've lost friends, my family became a mess and I became a lone wolf in my own way, just before I met someone that became special to me, just for that person disappear from my life like the others did. [b] Everybody lies. No exceptions [/b]. I know it's a popular thing nowadays to say [i] "Oh, that character is just like me" [/i] but this thing here isn't what people have been doing with Netflix's Wednesday or something like that, I didn't expect that, but it happened. Chloe Price is not a real person, but she was able to do something that nobody else was able to: she made me strong.

Life is Strange shaped my personality, my music taste, my art style, my cloth style (maybe some of you will notice that my hair in the profile pic is blue, yeah... you can guess why), not just because I really like this game, but because it did things to me that I would never imagine that a game would do.

So yes, I recommend this game. Please, play it. Damn I feel like crying just by writing this, I'm so thankful to DONTNOD for developing such a masterpiece, a masterpiece that didn't need 4K RTX graphics to impress and neither an ultra high budget mocap technology to do so, just love and an amazing story. Fuck, I'll never forget this game, thank you devs and thank you Chloe Price, I'll never give up.

Keep smiling! :) oh, sorry, NO EMOJI!!!

135915830.review: Very good and involving story. Full of difficult choices.

135910146.review:
This game saved my life.

I am 33.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥ing minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

135901284.review:
Life is Strange es una obra maestra del género de aventuras gráficas, que ha logrado capturar la atención y el corazón de los jugadores de todo el mundo. La trama del juego es compleja y emocional, presentando a los jugadores una historia profunda y fascinante que se desarrolla en un ambiente lleno de misterios y sorpresas.

Los personajes del juego son increíblemente bien desarrollados, y la narrativa del juego les permite crecer y evolucionar a lo largo de la historia. Los jugadores se sentirán profundamente conectados con los personajes y sus experiencias, lo que les permite empatizar y entender mejor los problemas que se presentan en el juego.

Además, el juego cuenta con un impresionante estilo artístico que es simplemente hermoso. La música y los efectos de sonido también están muy bien hechos, sumergiendo a los jugadores aún más en la atmósfera emotiva y evocadora del juego.

En general, Life is Strange es un juego que nunca olvidarás. La historia, los personajes, el arte y la música se combinan para crear una experiencia de juego única e inolvidable. Si eres fanático de las aventuras gráficas y estás buscando un juego con una narrativa emocionante y bien construida, Life is Strange es definitivamente una excelente elección.

135558585.review: I first played Life is Strange back in 6th grade when it was a free monthly PlayStation Plus exclusive. I usually don't pay attention to PS+ monthly games, especially one that is a single-player story game. It was definitely not a game i would typically download, however, i'm so glad that I did. I have so much nostalgia for Life is Strange. The plot, Max and Chloe, the music, the beautiful scenery of Arcadia Bay; I fell in love with all of it. Since the 7 years when I first finished the game, I have replayed it countless times. The game does a great job at making you feel like you yourself are a student at Blackwell High, living in the small but eventful town of Arcadia Bay. For anyone who hasn't played Life is Strange, I strongly recommend that you do. I have bought all the games, including the remasters, and though Life is Strange 2 felt weak to me (I only got half way through the game before it was unplayable), all entries in the series are pretty good as well. Looking forward to Life is Strange 4.
